# Find what you need faster with enterprise search software

When you can’t find the information you need, work comes to a halt. Glean’s enterprise search software is designed to solve this problem by connecting all your company’s knowledge in one place, powered by AI, to deliver instant, relevant results.

See Glean in action

## 5 reasons why you should use enterprise search software

#1

Instantly search across all your tools [...] ### Make onboarding seamless for new hires

Help new hires hit the ground running with instant access to the knowledge and tools they need to succeed from day one. Glean saved new hires an average of 36 hours on onboarding.

## How Glean’s enterprise search software works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

Whether it’s a meeting, a presentation, or an email, Glean pulls together reports, past conversations, and external insights — so you always walk in prepared.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

Glean Search [...] ### State-of-the-art deep learning.

 Vector search powered by deep learning-based LLMs enables semantic understanding for natural language queries.
 Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context to improve search relevance. No need for manual fine-tuning.
 AI grounded in your company’s own trusted knowledge model delivers the answers you need.

Find more info

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

### Supercharged by generative AI.

 Get document summaries in seconds, rather than wading through pages of content.
 Find answers to questions based on the most up-to date information from across all your company’s apps.
 Ask follow up questions with Glean Chat to gain additional insights.

Explore Assistant

Enterprise search [...] ## Real-time indexing

### Trusted results.

 Search results are indexed in real time, so employees can always find the latest information.
 Pin important items to the top of search results to highlight key information.
 Glean enforces the existing permissions of your data sources in results, so users only see what they are allowed to access.

## How Search Works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean's unified search bar, whether you're looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company's apps to find exactly what you need.### Understand

# Find what you need faster with enterprise search software

When you can’t find the information you need, work comes to a halt. Glean’s enterprise search software is designed to solve this problem by connecting all your company’s knowledge in one place, powered by AI, to deliver instant, relevant results.

See Glean in action

## 5 reasons why you should use enterprise search software

#1

Instantly search across all your tools [...] ### Make onboarding seamless for new hires

Help new hires hit the ground running with instant access to the knowledge and tools they need to succeed from day one. Glean saved new hires an average of 36 hours on onboarding.

## How Glean’s enterprise search software works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

Whether it’s a meeting, a presentation, or an email, Glean pulls together reports, past conversations, and external insights — so you always walk in prepared.

### Accelerate research-heavy workflows.

From market research to internal reporting, Glean reasons, gathers, filters, and organizes data so you can focus on making decisions, not digging for information.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

### Trusted results.

https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/15/the-en.title: The enterprise AI land grab is on. Glean is building the layer beneath the interface. - TechCrunch
https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/15/the-en.content: Seven years ago, Glean set out to be the Google for enterprise — an AI-powered search tool designed to index and search across a company’s SaaS tool library, from Slack to Jira, Google Drive to Salesforce. “The layer we built initially – a good search product – required us to deeply understand people and how they work and what their preferences are,” Jain told TechCrunch on last week’s episode of Equity, which we recorded at Web Summit Qatar. “The AI models themselves don’t really understand anything about your business,” Jain said. Rather than forcing companies to commit to a single LLM provider, Glean acts as the abstraction layer, allowing enterprises to switch between or combine models as capabilities evolve. Enterprises can’t simply load all their internal data into a model and create a wrapper to sort out the solutions later, says Jain. Jain argues enterprises don’t want to be locked into a single model or productivity suite and would rather opt for a neutral infrastructure layer rather than a vertically integrated assistant.
https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/15/the-en.query: Glean enterprise AI strategic alliances integrations with other enterprise platforms

https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/13/ai-start.title: Enterprise AI startup Cohere tops revenue target as momentum builds to IPO: Investor memo - CNBC
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/13/ai-start.content: # Enterprise AI startup Cohere tops revenue target as momentum builds to IPO: Investor memo. * Cohere hit roughly $240 million in annual recurring revenue last year, surpassing its $200 million target, according to a February investor memo viewed by CNBC. * The company develops AI models and builds software tools for enterprise customers. Artificial intelligence startup Cohere has told investors that it's seeing momentum with enterprise customers, even as rivals like Google, Anthropic and OpenAI claw for market share. Cohere's investor memo comes after CEO Aidan Gomez said in October that the startup hopes to make its public market debut "soon." He told Bloomberg that he thinks investors would welcome a "pure play AI investment opportunity.". This approach allows Cohere to invest "more aggressively" in customer acquisition and research and development, according to its investor memo. **WATCH:** Cohere CEO names the barriers to enterprise AI adoption. Cohere CEO names the barriers to enterprise AI adoption.

https://www.theverge.com/tech/880401/goo.title: Google announces dates for I/O 2026 - The Verge
https://www.theverge.com/tech/880401/goo.content: This year’s event will feature Google’s ‘latest AI breakthroughs’ and updates across its products. This year’s event will feature Google’s ‘latest AI breakthroughs’ and updates across its products. In an announcement on Tuesday, Google says it will share the “latest AI breakthroughs and updates in products across the company, from Gemini to Android and more” during the event, which will take place in-person in Mountain View, California’s Shoreline Amphitheatre, and online. Similar to previous years, Google I/O 2026 will feature keynotes from company leaders, fireside chats, product demos, and more. Google announced a ton of AI-related news at last year’s I/O, including the broader expansion of AI Mode for Google Search and the launch of its AI filmmaking app Flow. This year is shaping up to be another AI-heavy event as the company continues expand on Gemini, along with the AI features across its search engine, Chrome, Workspace apps, and Pixel devices.

https://techcrunch.com/podcast/glean-arv.title: Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company - TechCrunch
https://techcrunch.com/podcast/glean-arv.content: # Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it? Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit beneath other AI experiences, connecting to internal systems, managing permissions, and delivering intelligence wherever employees work. On this episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, Rebecca Bellan sits down with Glean founder and CEO Arvind Jain at Web Summit Qatar to break down how enterprises are thinking about AI architecture, what’s driving consolidation, and what’s real versus hype in the AI agent space. * The fight between bundled AI from tech titans like Microsoft and Google, and platform layers like Glean and its competitors. You also can follow Equity on X and Threads, at @EquityPod. Theresa Loconsolo is an audio producer at TechCrunch focusing on Equity, the network’s flagship podcast. ### Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company.

https://techcrunch.com/video/who-will-ow.title: Who will own your company’s AI layer? Glean’s CEO explains - TechCrunch
https://techcrunch.com/video/who-will-ow.content: # Who will own your company’s AI layer? But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it? Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit underneath other AI experiences, connecting to internal systems, managing permissions, and delivering intelligence wherever employees work. Investors are buying into the vision, too — the startup raised $150 million last year at a $7.2 billion valuation as more competition heats up against tech giants bundling AI. Watch as Equity host Rebecca Bellan sits down with Glean’s CEO and founder Arvind Jain at Web Summit Qatar to break down how enterprises are thinking about AI architecture, what’s driving consolidation, and what’s real versus hype in the agent space. You also can follow Equity onX andThreads, at @EquityPod. AI, AI agents, AI consolidation, Arvind Jain, Equity Video, Glean, Startups, Web Summit Qatar. https://www.techloy.com/cognizant-to-rol.content: Cognizant, the American IT solutions company announced an expanded partnership with Google Cloud today centered on deploying Gemini Enterprise and Google Workspace across its entire global workforce before packaging the same system for enterprise clients. “This partnership reinforces Cognizant’s position as an AI builder, a new kind of services partner focused on creating purpose-built, enterprise-grade solutions that drive real business outcomes,” said Annadurai Elango, President of Core Technologies and Insights at Cognizant. Cognizant is establishing a dedicated Gemini Enterprise Center of Excellence to prove that AI agents can be as reliable as traditional software. “Our partnership with Cognizant brings together advanced AI technology and deep industry expertise to help enterprises operationalize agentic AI,” said Kevin Ichhpurani, President of Global Ecosystem and Channels at Google Cloud. According to Cognizant, the enhanced partnership positions the company as a builder and operator of agentic AI systems at a time when enterprises are seeking clarity, governance, and measurable business impact from their AI investments.

https://www.cio.com/article/4132210/serv.title: ServiceNow acquires Pyramid Analytics to boost self-service analytics - cio.com
https://www.cio.com/article/4132210/serv.content: “ServiceNow’s analytics capabilities have historically been operationally focused, centered on reporting and dashboards tied to ServiceNow records and workflows, with KPI visualization within a single Now instance such as ITSM, CSM, HRSD, or SecOps. These tools are strong for workflow optimization and operational insights but largely rely on ServiceNow data and embedded processes, limiting their scope for cross-enterprise BI,” said Pareekh Jain, principal analyst at Pareekh Consulting. ServiceNow plans to integrate Pyramid’s semantic and modeling capabilities into its Now AI Platform to help enterprise users to move from simple analysis to automated action without toggling between systems or workflows. This integration is a strategic maneuver by ServiceNow to strengthen its hand in large enterprise transformation engagements as competitive pressure mounts from rival SaaS providers, who are also seeking to position their platforms as end-to-end AI operating systems, said Gogia. By embedding enterprise grade analytics and foundations for agentic AI inside its platform, ServiceNow strengthens its wallet share argument and reduces displacement risk,” he added.

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

Glean Search [...] ### State-of-the-art deep learning.

 Vector search powered by deep learning-based LLMs enables semantic understanding for natural language queries.
 Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context to improve search relevance. No need for manual fine-tuning.
 AI grounded in your company’s own trusted knowledge model delivers the answers you need.

## Generative AI

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

### Supercharged by generative AI.

 Get document summaries in seconds, rather than wading through pages of content.
 Find answers to questions based on the most up-to date information from across all your company’s apps.
 Ask follow up questions with Glean Chat to gain additional insights.

Explore Assistant

Enterprise search [...] ## Real-time indexing

### Trusted results.

 Search results are indexed in real time, so employees can always find the latest information.
 Pin important items to the top of search results to highlight key information.
 Glean enforces the existing permissions of your data sources in results, so users only see what they are allowed to access.

## How Search Works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean's unified search bar, whether you're looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company's apps to find exactly what you need.### Understand

### Onboard new hires quickly

Search for answers to questions and browse curated collections of content. Get going without waiting for someone to explain context or company acronyms.

### Understand who’s who

Quickly look up people at your company to understand who they are, what they’re working on, and how they can help you move faster.

# Find what you need faster with enterprise search software

When you can’t find the information you need, work comes to a halt. Glean’s enterprise search software is designed to solve this problem by connecting all your company’s knowledge in one place, powered by AI, to deliver instant, relevant results.

See Glean in action

## 5 reasons why you should use enterprise search software

#1

Instantly search across all your tools [...] ### Make onboarding seamless for new hires

Help new hires hit the ground running with instant access to the knowledge and tools they need to succeed from day one. Glean saved new hires an average of 36 hours on onboarding.

## How Glean’s enterprise search software works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

Whether it’s a meeting, a presentation, or an email, Glean pulls together reports, past conversations, and external insights — so you always walk in prepared.

### Eliminate repetitive searches — just ask once.

Instead of running the same search across different platforms, Glean does it for you, pulling data from Slack, Salesforce, Google Drive, and any other connected apps.

### Accelerate research-heavy workflows.

From market research to internal reporting, Glean reasons, gathers, filters, and organizes data so you can focus on making decisions, not digging for information.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

### Protect your data with a graph built for your enterprise.

 Vector search powered by deep learning-based LLMs enables semantic understanding for natural language queries.
 Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context to improve search relevance. No need for manual fine-tuning.
 AI grounded in your company’s own trusted knowledge model delivers the answers you need.

## Generative AI

### Supercharged by generative AI.

 Get document summaries in seconds, rather than wading through pages of content.
 Find answers to questions based on the most up-to date information from across all your company’s apps.
 Ask follow up questions with Glean Chat to gain additional insights.

Explore Assistant

Enterprise search [...] ## Real-time indexing

### Trusted results.

 Search results are indexed in real time, so employees can always find the latest information.
 Pin important items to the top of search results to highlight key information.
 Glean enforces the existing permissions of your data sources in results, so users only see what they are allowed to access.

### Onboard new hires quickly

Search for answers to questions and browse curated collections of content. Get going without waiting for someone to explain context or company acronyms.

### Understand who’s who

Quickly look up people at your company to understand who they are, what they’re working on, and how they can help you move faster.

### Stay connected, no matter what

Whether you’re in the office or remote, Glean shows you what’s most popular at your company. No need to hang around the water cooler.

### Access tribal knowledge

Never start from scratch again. Discover the insights your team already knows, answers that have already been shared, and people who know even more.

# Find what you need faster with enterprise search software

When you can’t find the information you need, work comes to a halt. Glean’s enterprise search software is designed to solve this problem by connecting all your company’s knowledge in one place, powered by AI, to deliver instant, relevant results.

See Glean in action

## 5 reasons why you should use enterprise search software

#1

Instantly search across all your tools [...] ### Make onboarding seamless for new hires

Help new hires hit the ground running with instant access to the knowledge and tools they need to succeed from day one. Glean saved new hires an average of 36 hours on onboarding.

## How Glean’s enterprise search software works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] ### Prepare for any conversation in minutes.

Whether it’s a meeting, a presentation, or an email, Glean pulls together reports, past conversations, and external insights — so you always walk in prepared.

### Eliminate repetitive searches — just ask once.

Instead of running the same search across different platforms, Glean does it for you, pulling data from Slack, Salesforce, Google Drive, and any other connected apps.

### Accelerate research-heavy workflows.

From market research to internal reporting, Glean reasons, gathers, filters, and organizes data so you can focus on making decisions, not digging for information.

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

Glean Search [...] ### State-of-the-art deep learning.

 Vector search powered by deep learning-based LLMs enables semantic understanding for natural language queries.
 Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context to improve search relevance. No need for manual fine-tuning.
 AI grounded in your company’s own trusted knowledge model delivers the answers you need.

Find more info

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

### Supercharged by generative AI.

 Get document summaries in seconds, rather than wading through pages of content.
 Find answers to questions based on the most up-to date information from across all your company’s apps.
 Ask follow up questions with Glean Chat to gain additional insights.

Explore Assistant

Enterprise search [...] ## Real-time indexing

### Trusted results.

 Search results are indexed in real time, so employees can always find the latest information.
 Pin important items to the top of search results to highlight key information.
 Glean enforces the existing permissions of your data sources in results, so users only see what they are allowed to access.

## How Search Works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean's unified search bar, whether you're looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company's apps to find exactly what you need.### Understand

https://bloomberry.com/data/glean/.content: # Companies that use Glean. Glean provides an enterprise AI platform that connects to all company data across apps like Slack, Google Workspace, and Microsoft 365, enabling employees to search, find answers, and automate workflows through AI assistants and agents with personalized, permission-aware results. Individual contributors like AI Solutions Engineers, Knowledge Managers, Data Analysts, and IT Operations Specialists actually work with Glean for search, knowledge sharing, and workflow automation. Companies describe needing to make knowledge actually usable, glean insights from data, and create deeper more meaningful connections. I noticed that companies using Glean are heavily focused on internal operations, developer productivity, and employee enablement. Similarly, Mindtickle appearing alongside Glean suggests these companies are scaling their sales teams rapidly and need both knowledge management (Glean) and sales enablement (Mindtickle) to get new reps productive faster. ## 👥 What types of companies is most likely to use Glean? Shows how much more likely Glean customers are to have each trait compared to all companies.

Today, Glean stands among the largest and fastest-growing pure-play enterprise AI companies in the world, with more than 1,000 employees and customers spanning over 27 countries. * **Shipped 200 new features:** Keeping pace with the rapid pace of AI and enterprise demand, Glean introduced a wave of innovations across its platform, including Glean Agents, an open, horizontal environment for building, deploying, and governing AI agents at work. * Blog: Glean surpasses $200M ARR as enterprises operationalize AI. Glean Assistant gives every employee a powerful enterprise AI assistant that connects to and understands company data via Glean’s Enterprise Graph, and Glean Agents empowers everyone to create, use, and manage AI agents using natural language.

# Find what you need faster with enterprise search software

When you can’t find the information you need, work comes to a halt. Glean’s enterprise search software is designed to solve this problem by connecting all your company’s knowledge in one place, powered by AI, to deliver instant, relevant results.

See Glean in action

## 5 reasons why you should use enterprise search software

#1

Instantly search across all your tools [...] ### Make onboarding seamless for new hires

Help new hires hit the ground running with instant access to the knowledge and tools they need to succeed from day one. Glean saved new hires an average of 36 hours on onboarding.

## How Glean’s enterprise search software works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean’s unified search bar, whether you’re looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company’s apps to find exactly what you need.

### Understand

Deep learning LLMs enable semantic understanding for natural language queries. Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context, delivering highly relevant results without manual fine-tuning.

### Generate

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] ### Prepare for any conversation in minutes.

Whether it’s a meeting, a presentation, or an email, Glean pulls together reports, past conversations, and external insights — so you always walk in prepared.

### Eliminate repetitive searches — just ask once.

Instead of running the same search across different platforms, Glean does it for you, pulling data from Slack, Salesforce, Google Drive, and any other connected apps.

### Accelerate research-heavy workflows.

From market research to internal reporting, Glean reasons, gathers, filters, and organizes data so you can focus on making decisions, not digging for information.

Explore Deep Research

Safely scale AI at work](/product/governance)[Security. # Build AI chatbots and agents with full enterprise context. Glean’s APIs make it easy to build secure, knowledgeable generative AI systems — without the hassle of managing enterprise data. Build secure, enterprise-grade AI applications without the complexity of managing infrastructure or data permissions. Use Glean’s APIs to integrate AI-powered search and intelligent agents where employees already work. Easily integrate Glean’s full Work AI platform into your apps, so employees can use Glean Assistant — or any other Glean agent — right where they already work. Connect MCP-enabled apps and IDEs directly to Glean to get enterprise-grounded context with enforced permissions — wherever you work. Read More](/resources/guides/glean-state-of-ai-2025).

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] The Enterprise Graph builds on a rich knowledge graph that identifies high-value entities — such as projects, people, customers, and products. Each entity is supported by a network of related signals — for example, all the documentation, support tickets, and feature specs connected to a certain product.   
  
This network goes beyond surface-level semantic understanding, providing nuanced context that helps distinguish between specifics, such as similar product names like Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 2.0 Pro.

Glean Search [...] ### State-of-the-art deep learning.

 Vector search powered by deep learning-based LLMs enables semantic understanding for natural language queries.
 Glean continuously trains on your company’s unique language and context to improve search relevance. No need for manual fine-tuning.
 AI grounded in your company’s own trusted knowledge model delivers the answers you need.

Find more info

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

Enterprise search

## Generative AI

### Supercharged by generative AI.

 Get document summaries in seconds, rather than wading through pages of content.
 Find answers to questions based on the most up-to date information from across all your company’s apps.
 Ask follow up questions with Glean Chat to gain additional insights.

Explore Assistant

Enterprise search [...] ## Real-time indexing

### Trusted results.

 Search results are indexed in real time, so employees can always find the latest information.
 Pin important items to the top of search results to highlight key information.
 Glean enforces the existing permissions of your data sources in results, so users only see what they are allowed to access.

## How Search Works

### Prompt

Type your query into Glean's unified search bar, whether you're looking for an insight stored in a document, a Slack message, or a Jira ticket. Glean searches across all your company's apps to find exactly what you need.### Understand

WebinarsNewsroomGlean:GO 2026EventsGleaniverse Community [...] ## How teams use Glean

### Onboard new hires quickly

Search for answers to questions and browse curated collections of content. Get going without waiting for someone to explain context or company acronyms.

### Understand who’s who

Quickly look up people at your company to understand who they are, what they’re working on, and how they can help you move faster.

### Stay connected, no matter what

Whether you’re in the office or remote, Glean shows you what’s most popular at your company. No need to hang around the water cooler.

### Access tribal knowledge

Never start from scratch again. Discover the insights your team already knows, answers that have already been shared, and people who know even more.

https://developers.glean.com/api/client-.content: # Tools API. The Tools API enables you to discover and execute various tools and integrations available within your Glean instance. Access external services, run automated workflows, and integrate with third-party applications to extend Glean's capabilities. ## Use Cases. ### Tool Discovery. Discover available tools and integrations within your Glean instance to understand what capabilities are accessible through the API. ### Workflow Automation. Execute tools programmatically to automate workflows, data processing, and integration tasks with external systems. ### Third-party Integration. Integrate with external services and applications through Glean's tool ecosystem to create comprehensive business solutions. ## API Endpoints. | POST | `/rest/api/v1/tools/call` | Execute the specified tool Execute the specified tool with provided parameters |. | GET | `/rest/api/v1/tools/list` | List available tools Returns a filtered set of available tools based on optional tool name parameters. If no filters are provided, all available tools are returned.

https://trust.glean.com/.title: Trust Center - Glean
https://trust.glean.com/.content: Glean is committed to building trust through rigorous security, transparent architecture, and proactive vulnerability management. ### RediShell Vulnerability Update (CVE-2025-49844). Recently, Redis disclosed CVE-2025-49844, a critical vulnerability with a CVSS score of 10.0 that could allow users to execute arbitrary code through specially crafted Lua scripts. Glean has applied the security patch to all versions of Redis that we deploy to customers. ### Ingress Nightmare (CVE-2025-1974) Vulnerability Update: Not Applicable to Glean systems. Recently, a critical vulnerability known as IngressNightmare (CVE-2025-1974) was disclosed, affecting the Ingress-NGINX controller used in Kubernetes environments. This vulnerability, with a CVSS score of 9.8, allows unauthenticated remote code execution and poses significant risks to Kubernetes clusters utilising Ingress-NGINX. However, we would like to inform our customers that this vulnerability does not impact Glean systems as we do not use NGINX or the affected ingress controller in our infrastructure. ### Stay Updated with Glean’s Trust Center! Here, we will share updates on vulnerabilities, certifications and our latest security enhancements.

https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-pricing.title: A guide to Glean pricing in 2025 - eesel AI
https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-pricing.content: # A guide to Glean pricing in 2025. This isn't "glean.ai", which is a tool for automating accounts payable. ### The Glean pricing model explained. Glean's pricing is mostly built around a **per-user, per-month** subscription. ### How much does Glean pricing cost? | **Starting Price** | $45 - $50+ / user / month | Base subscription fee per employee. ## The hidden costs and challenges of the Glean pricing model. ## A transparent alternative for AI support: eesel AI pricing. ## Glean pricing: Choosing the right model for your team. Platforms like eesel AI offer predictable, value-based pricing and a self-serve experience that lets you get going in minutes. Ready for an AI support platform with transparent pricing and a setup that takes minutes, not months? Glean uses a traditional enterprise sales model, which means they don't publish a public pricing page. The core of Glean's pricing model is a per-user, per-month subscription.
https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-pricing.query: Glean enterprise AI pricing plans sales process

https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-ai-prici.title: Glean AI pricing: A 2025 guide to its real costs & alternatives - eesel AI
https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-ai-prici.content: # Glean AI pricing: A 2025 guide to its real costs & alternatives. In this guide, we're going to pull back the curtain on the Glean AI pricing model, dig into the hidden costs you need to watch for, and show you a more transparent, self-serve alternative that puts you in control from day one. ### The Glean AI pricing per-user, per-month model with high minimums. ## Hidden costs of Glean AI pricing. Beyond the per-user fee, mandatory support costs (often 10% of ARR) are typically added to Glean AI pricing. You generally need to engage in a sales process, and a Proof of Concept (POC) to test the tool may require a significant upfront payment, adding to the initial Glean AI pricing consideration. Your final Glean AI pricing quote will depend on several factors, including your company size (total users), the number of integrations you require, the specific feature set you need, and the level of customer support you choose.
https://www.eesel.ai/blog/glean-ai-prici.query: Glean enterprise AI pricing plans sales process

https://www.gosearch.ai/blog/glean-prici.content: Whether you’ve encountered Glean AI during your search for smarter workplace tools or are comparing vendors as part of a formal procurement process, this guide will help you understand Glean pricing, how it compares to other solutions in the market – and why buyers are asking for greater transparency. ## **Glean Work AI Pricing**. Additionally, renewing customers can expect renewal pricing to reflect this added functionality, as Work AI is now bundled with enterprise search – no longer optional, but a core part of the platform. Glean’s pricing positions it at the higher end of the enterprise search and AI productivity space compared to competitors. Here’s how Glean compares to other enterprise search tools based on publicly available and reported pricing data:. *Learn more about Glean alternatives in our* *Enterprise Search Pricing Guide* comparing Glean vs. ###### Compare Glean total cost of ownership vs GoSearch, including pricing, POC costs, support fees, and long-term enterprise search TCO drivers.

https://www.glean.com/perspectives/maxim.content: The impact extends beyond simple time savings: companies using AI-powered proposal tools report dramatic improvements in win rates, faster response times to RFPs, and better alignment across sales teams. By integrating AI into the sales process, teams can automate routine tasks, improve accuracy, and deliver highly customized proposals that resonate with clients. Leveraging AI insights, sales teams can infuse creativity into their proposals, making them more compelling and relevant to each client. By empowering sales teams with timely, actionable insights, AI enhances both the quality and reliability of proposals. AI sales assistants transform proposals by leveraging in-depth client insights. AI sales assistants enhance efficiency by automating the proposal creation process, allowing teams to address RFPs and client inquiries swiftly. By automating these elements, AI enables sales teams to concentrate on strategic initiatives and client engagement, ensuring that each interaction is impactful and productive. The future of sales belongs to teams that embrace AI's potential to transform how they create, personalize, and deliver proposals.

https://www.vendr.com/buyer-guides/glean.content: Based on Vendr’s internal transaction data for Glean AI, the minimum price varies based on a company's specific needs. However, the maximum price for Glean AI software can reach up to $84,000. ## Vendr community insights for Glean AI. ## How can I get a percentage off list price for Glean AI?
